comments.body: I'm not sure what the significance of this Duration is vis performance or if it corresponds to a real user's fling gesture or what the relationship between the fling velocity and the fling rate is. I think tests like this should be based on a range of experimentally determined, genuine human user, fling gesture profiles.
Not sure what we're waiting for here, not sure what the wait's significance is vis performance, not clear what 500ms is based on.
Just copy/pasta from https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/master/dev/benchmarks/complex_layout/test_driver/scroll_perf_test.dart, happy to change.  FYI @vlidholt

And that's copypasta from my code :) If you think of scrolling as a sequence of "pointer down", "drag", "pointer up", "move finger back to the original location", "pointer down", "drag", etc, then this pause emulates the "move finger back to the original location" part. The duration of 500ms is, just like the scroll duration above it, is not based on any empirical data. It was just me testing the testing framework. Also, `scroll` does not emulate the acceleration/deceleration of a user's finger. We need to do some homework in this area.
